intro: Castanopsis kweichowensis, commonly known as the Yunnan tallow tree, is a species of evergreen broadleaf tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, thick leaves and spiny acorns. The plant is typically found in subtropical forests and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils. It plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
